Html:
What is the password to unzip the latest .zip file (2217)?

Been fighting this for 5days, I figure why not start from scratch with the latest file! Haven't been able to get it LIVE- all pages expect Default, the News pages and the Events pages were working (after a ton of little fixes), but I can't figure out issues with those pages, so hoping latest file doesn't have those issues.

It would be great if the Welcome page in this kit could tell you about the database issues (ie setup tables on web server, upload data, upload procedures - (shared host doesn't let you connect using any tool other than their web tool). I was a complete newbie a week ago to everthing but basic html, but by the end of this project I'll be ready for anything(yeah right)

Zack - THANK YOU for cluing me in to set the virtual directory - hopefully that will fix the navigational links when I try to go live with this latest version.

Thanks to everyone for all the work on this, it's unimaginable the work ya'll must have put in.
admin is the username and password. Thanks for your patronage to the project!

I set up a brand new database, used the latest source(2231), and other than connection strings I didn't change anything. After cutting and pasting from the "2000.sql" file to my web host's "query analyzer tool" I was left with about 20 "statements" that wouldn't "analyze". How can I get those procedures to "analyze"? I tried 3 different times and in different order to see if those few would load - to no avail. The errors are pasted below. All pages except the default.aspx are on the web.

Pages that were working last night now aren't and I don't know enough about anything to know how to fix, other than start plodding thru again and printing out all the procedures that did upload and compare them to the stored procedures in the CSK and then compare each table's setup. Is there an easier way?? Please tell me how to get this live and working. THANK YOU!

And I thought I knew how to set the virtual directory - in Visual Web Developer I selected the folder did F4 for properties and where it said "Developer Web Server" under "Virtual path" I entered /, but when I uploaded I still wound up with everything reflecting as being in a subfolder ie> www.disciplesondirt.com/DOD.

Do you guys have a host that let's you upload the whole sql file or attach to the DB using the SQL Server Mgmt Studio - this is making me nuts!

ERRORS:
Could not drop object 'dbo.aspnet_Applications' because it is referenced by a FOREIGN KEY constraint.
/****** Object: Table dbo.aspnet_Applications Script Date: 02/22/2007 19:13:33 ******/
IF EXISTS (SELECT * FROM dbo.sysobjects WHERE id = OBJECT_ID(N'dbo.aspnet_Applications') AND OBJECTPROPERTY(id, N'IsUserTable') = 1)
DROP TABLE dbo.aspnet_Applications
GO


Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint 'PK_BlogComments'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'BlogComments'.
SET IDENTITY_INSERT dbo.BlogComments ON
INSERT dbo.BlogComments (commentid, postid, Name, Email, Comment) VALUES (1, 1, convert(text, N'Zack' collate SQLLatin1GeneralCP1CIAS), convert(text, N'zowens@eagleenvision.net' collate SQLLatin1GeneralCP1CIAS), convert(text, N'This is an example commeThis is an example comment.This is an example comment.This is an example comment.nt.' collate SQLLatin1GeneralCP1CI_AS))
SET IDENTITY_INSERT dbo.BlogComments OFF


Violation of PRIMARY KEY constraint 'PK_BlogPosts'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'BlogPosts'.
(I'M NOT ADDING ALL THE CODE THAT WENT WITH THIS ONE HERE)

The SQL scripts aren't from that build. I don't generate every build b/c it takes way too long. You can use This tool to generate the updated SQL statements. You don't need SQL Management... just VS 2005. I can generate the update scripts tonight though.

Virtual directories are set up with your hoster.
OK, I just regenerated the SQL scripts.
